intro: Bertiera guianensis var. leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaf bertiera, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse growth forms and ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its smooth, leathery leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and animals.
